meanings.definition: To make a detailed list of items
meanings.sent1: I inventoried all the toys in my room to see which ones were missing.
meanings.sent2: The store manager inventoried the new shipment of products as they arrived.
meanings.sent3: My little sister inventoried her stuffed animals and found she had two of the same bear.
meanings.sent4: She inventoried her memories, carefully cataloging each significant moment.
meanings.sent5: The detective inventoried the evidence, hoping to find a clue to solve the case.

meanings.definition: Having been recorded in an inventory
meanings.sent1: The inventoried items were neatly organized on the shelves.
meanings.sent2: The missing books were later found and marked as inventoried.
meanings.sent3: The inventoried supplies were all accounted for, except for one missing pen.
meanings.sent4: The inventoried goods were ready for shipment to the warehouse.
meanings.sent5: The inventoried artifacts were carefully preserved in the museum's collection.
